thread.title: The Best and Worst U.S. Cities for Finding a Job In 2017
thread.title_full: The Best and Worst U.S. Cities for Finding a Job In 2017

author: Patrick Allan
title: The Best and Worst U.S. Cities for Finding a Job In 2017
text:
If you’re hoping to land a new gig in the new year, these cities are the best places to start looking. Advertisement 
To determine the best cities for jobs, WalletHub took a look at the job market and socioeconomic environment for the 150 most populated areas across the U.S. The data includes metrics from 23 categories, including the number of job opportunities, employment growth rate, median salaries, job security, employee benefits, and even worker commutes to help assess general well being. According to WalletHub’s experts, these are the top five cities for jobs this year: Scottsdale, AZ
